means: 艰难的，讨厌的，不值得羡慕的

sentence.Network_en: It put me in the unenviable position of having to lie.
sentence.Network_cn: 这令我陷入了不得不说谎的尴尬境地。

sentence.Network_en: Walker had the unenviable task of breaking the bad news to Hill.
sentence.Network_cn: 沃克不得不把这个坏消息告诉希尔。

sentence.Network_en: She had the unenviable task of making the first few phone calls.
sentence.Network_cn: 她接受了这个令人为难的差事，负责打头几个电话。

PerfectNetExp.abs: unenlightening 无启发作用的unenviable 不值得羡慕的unequal to 不等于
a. 不值得羡慕的,不羡慕的,不嫉妒的同反义词同: [a.] awkward, embarrassing, sticky 参考例句 He is in the unenviable position of having to choose.
He took on an unenviable task , like a leader taking on the throne amid turmoil ., 他接手了一项不值得羡慕的任务 , 就像在剧烈动荡时期登上王位的领袖.

list.abs: 美国大学翻译中文 3 - geovindu的日志 -... ... 不婚率 occurrence 不嫉妒 unenvious 不孕 barrenness.
unenvious的用法例句1. unenvious adj. 不妒忌的, 不羡慕的, 无恶意的, 不吝惜的更多
He has an unenviable record of ill - health ., 他一直身体不好 , 这可不值得羡慕.
such a difficult choice placed her in an invidious and unenviable position .如此艰难的选择使她处于一种引起反感的和尴尬的境地。
He always found himself in the unenviable position of borrowing money from a friend ., 他总觉得跟朋友借钱很难开口.

entry.tran: 不值得羡慕的；令人不快的；尴尬的
entry.def: If you describe a situation or task as unenviable, you mean that nobody would enjoy dealing with it because it is very difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant.

example.ex: She had the unenviable task of making the first few phone calls...
example.tran: 她接受了这个令人为难的差事，负责打头几个电话。

example.ex: It put me in the unenviable position of having to lie.
example.tran: 这令我陷入了不得不说谎的尴尬境地。

means.word_mean: 1. hard to deal with; especially causing pain or embarrassment;

sentences.sentence: "awkward (or embarrassing or difficult) moments in the discussion"
"in the unenviable position of resorting to an act he had planned to save for the climax of the campaign"

means.word_mean: 2. so undesirable as to be incapable of arousing envy;

auth_sentence.content: He described this as the "unenviable option".
auth_sentence.res_content: He described this as the "unenviable option".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He described this as the "unenviable option".

auth_sentence.content: That would be an unenviable and undesirable circumstance.
auth_sentence.res_content: That would be an unenviable and undesirable circumstance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That would be an unenviable and undesirable circumstance.

auth_sentence.content: Though he didn't say it, it's an unenviable task.
auth_sentence.res_content: Though he didn't say it, it's an unenviable task.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Though he didn't say it, it's an unenviable task.

means.word_mean: 艰难的;讨厌的;不值得羡慕的

sentences.en: Cooper had the unenviable job of announcing the redundancies.
sentences.cn: 库伯负责宣布裁员这个不讨好的任务。

sentences.en: He has an unenviable record of ill-health.
sentences.cn: 他一直身体不好，这可不值得羡慕。
